noun.description: A length or square of fabric worn around the neck or head.
examples: she tucked her woolly scarf around her neck

verb.description: Join the ends of (two pieces of timber or metal) by beveling or notching them so that they fit over or into each other.
examples: he forced me to scarf the keel timbers in watertight sections
the scarfing follows the natural grain of the wood

verb.description: Make an incision in the blubber of (a whale).
